newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Canada's Abacan tumbles.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Canada's Abacan tumbles.

text.p: Canadian oil company Abacan Resource Corp fell sharply Monday to highlight trade in American Depositary Receipts ADRs and foreign shares.

Shares in the Calgary-based company fell three points, or more than 50 percent, to 2-13/16. Abacan was the most-active foreign share at midday, with 8.5 million shares traded -- almost 25 times normal daily volume.

The fall came after Abacan said its 1997 cash flow would be much lower than analysts' predictions. It blamed the drop on reduced average production, lower oil prices and higher-than-expected startup costs.

Among other active shares, Singaporean software company Creative Technology Ltd rose 1-1/4 to 17 after it said it obtained another preliminary court order against Cyrix Corp and some customers of Cyrix's Media GX chip, including Compaq Computer Corp.
Creative has filed a federal suit alleging Cyrix and the customers were misleading consumers about the computer audio solution provided by the Cyrix Media GX chipset.
Creative's chief executive said Sunday the company would carry out a $50 million marketing campaign to support its Sound Blaster AWE64 audio standard for personal computers.
Among Latin American shares, Brazilian telephone company
Hong Kong Telecommunications Ltd fell 1/2 to 23-3/4.
